intro: Corydalis luquanensis, commonly known as the Luquan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces slender, branched stems and has palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
